reviews.sentence: Wow what a great place. Got a great deal on Hotwire while taking a roadtrip over Christmas vacation and what a beautiful hotel this is. Not only was the room fabulous but the staff was genuine and super friendly as well as helpful. My husband left his personal pillow there and they actually located it and sent it to us. it was above and beyond. We plan to go back to Chattanooga just to stay there again. Upscale yet lots of southern charm and hospitality.

Old fashioned design. Great firepits outside. but you had to sit on cold concrete benches. Surrounding area was not really downtown. more like warehouse district. felt the area brought down the worth of the hotel. Also parking was totally inconvenient.

First time in the city. stayed one night. friendly front desk. good restaurant recommendation within walking. the fire was a definite welcome with an area to sit and enjoy. the king bed was very comfortable and the room was spotless. Bigrst disappointment was no complimentary hot tea and coffee in the lobby. I am not a coffee drinkerand not being able to get hot water for a cup of tea was ofputing. for what is suppose to be a 4 star. I know it was too cold to walk around To see the access to other sights so can not comment on location. When we return to the city we will most likely not stay again. It was an okay hotel. I would recommend management consider providing something for hot tea drinkers. Thanks. I THINK YOU WILL FIND THAT APECIAED.

Not Impressed. This Is Not A Four Diamond Property. I would have rated this experience between poor and average. The property is pleasing enough nice lobby with the warmest fireplace I have ever felt. Nice on the cold nigts we were there. Check in process could have been better if they had had more than one person at the check in desk. The young man was helping the people before us and it took a long time. Not only was he checking them in to the hotel he was also selling aquarium tickets and explaining transportation and directions. They need more than one person or possibly a concierge to do this so other who are merely checking in do not have such a long wait. When he got to us he failed to key our keys to both doors of the suite we had and he never offered us any aquarium tickets. Our suite was nice. Very large with 2 big rooms and a bath and 12. The water pressure in the shower was poor. The security locks on both doors are a latch that slides into another piece. The one on the door that he did not key was broken. I feel this should be something that is checked and repaired before they rent the room. It is truly needed for extra security and peace of mind. Also one of the TVs did not turn on at all. We called for this and they replaced the dead batteries. again something that should be checked before they put a guest in the room. We requested turndown but never received it. i mentioned it to another front desk person and she said she would make sure we got in that evening. Never happened. Two different people said it would be done but was not. They provide coffee in the lobby in the morning but it was so bitter we could not drink it. It was the same in the restaurant Broad Street Grill which i will review seperately. They offer valet or garage parking. The garage is quite a hike from the lobby. When the bill arrived under our door the rate for both nights was incorrect. I had double checked this prior to arrival and had a confirmation with the correct rates. They adjusted it. it was almost a 100 error in their favor. I am glad I checked it sometimes we are in a rush and just pay. So all in all we were not that happy with this hotel. AAA should not rate it above 3 stars.

First off Josh. The guy who greeted us at the front desk around 11 pm on 32915. He saw us coming across the lobby and greeted us warmly then proceeded to check us in with a smile. He was pleasant friendly informative and professional. My boyfriend and I travel for a living and interact with many late night front desk attendants and we both agreed that Josh has given us the best customer service we have encountered in a long time. People like Josh MAKE 4star hotels. The Chatanogan is lucky to have him. About the hotel itself the room was clean and comfortable the internet was fast tv was great. A word on parking it does cost 8 per day so come prepared for that charge and do not give Josh any guff ok. We ate breakfast in the hotel. NOTE. the guide in our room said breakfast was at 11 am but it is actually at 1030am. We barely made it in time but the dining room staff were not put out and allowed us to partake even as they were preparing for lunch. They even offered to grab items from the buffet for us so we would not have to rush an unexpected kindness. The buffet was aprox. 13 and was quite good. Lastly for those who complain that this hotel is too far from local attractions A There is a FREE trolley that stops on the street IN FRONT OF THE HOTEL. It makes stops at most of the major downtown attractions. B. The Chatanogan is 1 mile from the Aquarium 25 from the Zoo 2 from the National Cemetery and only a 15 minute drive from Ruby Falls. This is 2015. Google Map your trip and be prepared to travel accordingly. it is not the hotels fault if you did not do your research. Overall a great hotel that I had recommend to visitors. Thank you for a great stay.

Hotel is excellent skip the extras. The room was clean and decent view of city. You could hear everything through the walls and doors down to the room beside us bathtub filling up To the maid cart going back and forth it is was very frustrating to come without two small children only not to enjoy peace and sleep in but to be awaken by the constant noise. Also SKIP the food at the bar and and broad street grille located in the hotel both have terrible service and food is far from good. We had one thing that was decent BQ nachos. Believe it or not and if you do not order top shelf liquors for the up charge you will be very disappointed.

Location location location. The main reason I would not stay here again is the location. I walked outside to wander around and within 30 seconds was approached by a man asking for money. In one direction the area looks a bit sketchy. The other direction is where you want to go if you want to explore but you have to go about a mile to get to anything worthwhile. Next time I will stay closer to the food entertainment district. The bar and food was okay although the kitchen messed up our order and only partially corrected their mistake and the entertainment cancelled last minute the night we chose to visit on our way in from our long day. Rooms were okay nothing very special. You have to pay for parking. The staff was nice and helpful. Spa is reasonably priced.

Great hotel for the money. The hotel is located off of the main streets of downtown Chattanooga however it is only a couple of blocks from all of the activity. Easy walk to restaurants shopping entertainment Warehouse Row. Hotel restaurants have Happy Hour drink cocktail specials and the food that we tried was very good. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

Very Nice Hotel. This was our first visit Chattanooga. The hotel was extremely clean the hotel staff was very friendly and check in was a breeze. My 5 year old son really appreciated the in door pool and me the hot tub. My husband and I had a few cocktails and they were really good an inexpensive. The only complaint I had was the restaurant located inside the hotel. It definitely was not a fine dinning experience. The food was just not good. Other than that the hotel was great.

Great place. Highly recommend. Very nice hotel in pretty much every way. Valet us are super friendly front desk staff are quick friendly. Rooms are nice comfy clean. Water pressure is serious in the shower haha. The spa is on the 2nd floor they offer massages such this is also where the pool is located. It is indoor really just a splash pool it is only 312 feet deep. There is a hot tub too. The pool chemicals are very strong which is good for germs but be aware. We read in one review not to stay on the 2nd floor because of the spa it would be noisy we were on the 2nd floor had no problems. Guess it just depends on who is at the hotel. The restaurants in the hotel are nice. Breakfast is a big buffet it is not included but that is to be expected this is not a holiday inn express it is a nicer upscale hotel with lots of banquet rooms even a small amphitheater. The chef waiters at breakfast carry on chit chat they were very funny. The towns free shuttle that runs every few minutes has a stop about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We used that but we also just walked to the aquarium area which was about a 2025 minute walk through town. We really enjoyed it we would definitely stay here again.

Nice place. Great staff nice location clean and comfortable. I travel 300 days per year world wide. This place has the next hotel internet I have ever experienced. 50 down 80 upTerible and annoyingly slow TV system with 38 channels. Shower pressure was low in our room but not others.

Very clean the rooms were comfortable and spacious. Good location close to downtown probably within a 10 15 minute walk to most shops restaurants and bars. Whole foods is 2 miles away. The internet connection and surfing experience was excellent. Parking is 8 dollars extra in the attached parking this should be more clear on the website. Breakfast was too expensive but the menu seemed godwe did not order this.

Great property but what is with those pillows. The location of the hotel was excellent for our plans. We booked last minute and the desk clerk originally gave us a less desirable room. We did discuss this with her and she moved us and apologized. The bed pillows are ridiculously uncomfortable and no one slept well.
Great place for company meetings. Comfortable rooms and convenient location. The restaurants food is nothing special but the bar is a great place for a nightcap after dinner out.
Good location friendly staff snd breakfast buffet. Construction all around.

We had a great time in Chattanooga at the Chatanogan. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was easy to get to yet in a quiet area. The daily cleaning was not complete such as water not replaced trash not emptied.
Exceptional. restaurant breakfast staff location. Parking was cumberson expensive inconvenient.
Great Location. The location was very handy to the downtown area. The view from our room was very nice toward Lookout Mountain. Free downtown shuttle was just one block away.
Location to other tourist attractions and event areas. Staff was friendly and helpful. ItÃ¢€â¢s not 4Star quality feel or appearance.

Disappointing and not value for money. Location was perfect for our trip we like to walk and we managed to get around easily on foot up to the station and down to the waterfront. Check in made us wait until 4pmToilet roll 1 plyCofe machine luxury no extra pods we only had one proper coffee per day very tight. No sound proofing from main corridor it was very noisyNo information in the room about the spaTV did not work when we arivedAirconditioning in room was insufficient due the way the room was set out. Room not vacumed. Main walk ways not clean lots of dirt on the carpetAl in all a 5 price for a 3 hotel experience. Check out staff did not ask us about our stay. Disappointing and we will not return.
